title: Visa cancellations sow panic for international students, with hundreds fearing deportation
author: Alice Masquelier-Page

facts.content: Immigration attorneys are receiving numerous inquiries from international students about visa status terminations.
At least 790 students at more than 120 colleges have had their visas revoked or legal status terminated.
1.1 million international students were in the United States last year.
Most affected students are from India and China.
International students are not eligible for federal financial aid.
Four students from Michigan universities are suing Trump administration officials.
Students claim they were terminated without clear reasons.
Secretary of State Marco Rubio stated the State Department is revoking visas of visitors acting counter to national interests.
Students have filed lawsuits arguing they were denied due process.
Federal judges have issued temporary restraining orders for some students.
